definition: stuck together as by glue (of lovers)/joined at the hip
as/as if/such as
to glue/glue/gum/rubber
see 似的[shi4 de5]
to seem/to appear/to resemble/similar/-like/pseudo-/(more) than
paint/lacquer/CL:道[dao4]/to paint (furniture, walls etc)

sentences.english: They cling to each other as if there were no tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 他們如膠似漆的像是沒有明天了。

sentences.english: "They love each other deeply, like glue and varnish, " described their Chinese friends.
sentences.chinese: 朋友們說，他們愛得很深，如膠似漆。

sentences.english: He sticks to her like glue, ie never leaves her.
sentences.chinese: 他如膠似漆地寸步不離開她。

sentences.english: Since then, he comes to here once a month and we get together.
sentences.chinese: 之後，他每個月都來看我，我們在一起，如膠似漆。

sentences.english: They are so attached to each other, it's like they are glued together.
sentences.chinese: 他們兩個如膠似漆，好像被膠水黏在一起似的。

sentences.english: Doris and Flora are inseparable. They're like two peas in a pod.
sentences.chinese: 多麗絲和弗洛拉兩個形影不離，如膠似漆。

definition: lit. don't fight, won't make friends (idiom); an exchange of blows may lead to friendship/no discord, no concord
inseparable (as form and shadow)
affectionate/an affectionate person
to treat each other as an honored guest (idiom)/mutual respect between husband and wife
to part on bad terms/(of a meeting etc) to break up in discord
to strive for favor
to be kind and love one another (idiom); bound by deep emotions
(of a couple) to be harmonious/to be each other's sunshine
lit. one palm alone cannot clap (proverb)/fig. it takes two persons to start a dispute/it takes two to tango/it's difficult to achieve anything without support
pinyin: yi1 ge5 ba1 zhang3 pai1 bu4 xiang3

definition: to rival sb for the affection of a man or woman/to be jealous of a rival in a love affair
to have a grudge against
(in former times) to bind one's hair on coming of age
to get married
to quarrel/to bicker/glib repartee
as if nothing had happened (idiom); calmly/nonchalantly
to question intensely/to interrogate/to demand information
